message: Any thoughts on drinks or anything happening Friday night? It's my first PyOhio, so I'm not sure what to expect! I'm heading over from Pittsburgh, probably going to show up around 9-10PM.
Good question. I'll probably be up late on Minecraft though. >.>
I should be getting to the conference hotel in the later afternoon — assuming that I successfully navigate the public transportation from the airport —
I'm landing at noon, plus however long its gonna take me to Red Roof Inn. My first PyOhio as well! (or any Python conference for that matter)
I'm essentially a native now (8 years), and I'll be around all day, and up for drinking in the evening.

@morganiangoose As a local, do you have any advice for those of us who need to get from the airport to the conference hotel this afternoon? :) Are the buses going to be our best bet if we don't want the expense of a cab ride?
I'll be at the airport about 6:15 to pick up @jleedev and can fit 1-2 others in my car, if anyone's arriving about then and wants a ride.
@brandon_rhodes  I think you are better off with a local, or a cab, what time you in?
You can take a cab for $15 if you call (614) 414-0000 and tell them you're going to Ohio State
@IbnFirnas Wow! The Ohio State site suggests a $25 charge, and $15 is more tempting when compared to taking three buses. :)
Indeed, I was about to take the scenic bus route myself - but dude at the cab line hooked me up!
I'm hanging-out at the Union Espress-OH, reading and hacking on random stuff.

Drat, I should have called that number and waited for their cab — the dude at the cab line said that a trip should only cost "$18 or $19" so I took a cab, only to have the total come to $31.40. And then I learned from the friendly bellhop that the Blackwell has a free shuttle to the airport! I just found that information on their web site, but it's listed in the "Accommodations" section where I hadn't looked for it. Oh well. Lesson learned: before traveling, call the hotel itself, and speak to a real person about how best to get there from the airport.
Planning on dinner with @empty shortly. Wondering where @aezellisdead is at!
Now walking up N High St toward Red Roof Inn on Ackerman.
Anyone else staying there that cares for dinner?
After walking back from dinner in the rain, I think the plan is going to be to do some bookie hacking in the lobby area of the blackwell. Anyone that wants to hack on stuff head on down.
Attending the Bookie Sprint in the Blackwell Lobby.

@jaaaarel I was having dinner with some local friends. We should get together tomorrow night starting out the Cocktail Hour my company is hosting at Eddie George's Grill. Everyone is invited of course.
Ooh, cocktail hour! Sounds like fun.
